original_content:
If you have an artistic bent, you might have seen self-inking stamp rollers. These are like rotary rubber stamps that leave a pattern as you roll across a page. [Becky] wanted a larger custom roller and turned to 3D printing to make it happen. The first prototype used a modified Sharpie. However, she soon moved to an unmodified acrylic marker that had a rectangular tip.
A Tinkercad design produces a cap that fits the market and a wheel that contains the desired pattern. Text works well, although you can easily do a custom pattern, too, of course.

The design counts. [Becky] noticed that commercial products had small artifacts deliberately on the design. Turns out these were made to help the roller spin reliably. Clearly, not everything will work as well as others when you use it as a pattern. But Tinkercad is easy enough, so you should be able to experiment easily.
If you prefer a more conventional rubber stamp, thats easy enough. If you want to do more advanced things in Tinkercad, check out how to do parameterization.
title: 3Dプリントを利用して自作の大型スタンプローラーを作る方法
body: 自己インキングスタンプローラーを作るために3Dプリントを使用した。デザインの重要性も判明。Tinkercadを使えば簡単に実験できる。もちろん通常のゴム印も作れる。より高度なことをする場合はパラメータ化について調べてみるといい。
titles: 3Dプリントを利用して自作の大型スタンプローラーを作る方法
Tinkercadで独自のデザインパターンを追加したスタンプローラーを作成する
カスタムスタンプローラーの作り方：Tinkercadを使った手順解説
自作スタンプローラーに必要なデザインの要点とは？
Tinkercadでのパラメータ化による高度なスタンプローラーデザインの方法
